name: Dr Hu Zeyu
title: Advancing Game Content Creation with LightSpeed's Self-developed Generative AI Technology
abstract: Lightspeed Studios unveils the transformative power of AI-Generated Content (AIGC) in shaping the future of game content creation. Our presentation will outline the sophisticated AIGC technologies that are redefining how game environments, characters, and interactions are conceived and delivered. From intricate 3D models to lifelike animations and dialogue, we will showcase the breadth of our AIGC's capabilities and its impact on elevating gaming to unprecedented levels of realism and engagement.
description: Zeyu Hu is a senior AI researcher at LightSpeed Studios Singapore, where his expertise in AI-driven game content creation has significantly contributed to the studio's pioneering efforts in the field. Before joining LightSpeed, he obtained his Ph.D. degree (2018-2023) at the Vision and Graphics Group, part of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. His Ph.D. advisor was Prof. Chiew-Lan Tai, and he also worked closely with Prof. Long Quan and Prof. Hongbo Fu.

name: Mr Foo Lin Geng
org: Singapore University of Technology and Design
title: Diffusion Models for 3D Human Pose and Mesh Recovery
abstract: 3D pose and mesh recovery is important for human behaviour understanding and game development. Meanwhile, diffusion models have achieved impressive performance for image and video generation tasks. We are the first to apply diffusion models to handle 3D pose and mesh recovery from monocular images and videos, and we created several key techniques enabling diffusion models to work well in handling this task.
description: Mr. Foo Lin Geng is currently a PhD student at Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD), and his research is supported by the President's Graduate Fellowship. His advisor is Prof. Liu Jun from the Information Systems and Design (ISTD) pillar. Prior to this, he obtained his Bachelor's Degree in Engineering Systems and Design (ESD), Summa Cum Laude (highest honors) from SUTD in 2019, where he also obtained the Keppel Award of Excellence in both 2018 and 2019, and the EY Business Analytics Award (awarded to the top student in the business analytics track). His current research interests include video analysis, activity understanding, and dynamic neural networks.

name: Associate Professor Zhu Feida
title: When AI Meet Web 3 for Sustainable Digital Economy
abstract: The recent boom of AI brings along with all the wonderful innovations concerns about the governance issues, in particular when the application context is bound to be increasingly collaborative in nature.  How to provide both trust and incentive when data, model and computational resources come from different entities? Web3 offers a solution. In this talk we will give an overview for the potential integration between AI and Web3, with the challenges and core technical components.  A few examples will also be given to illustrate the marriage between the two.
description: His research interests include large-scale data mining and machine learning, blockchain and data asset, text mining, graph/network mining and social network analysis, with emphasis on their application to business, financial and consumer innovation. He was the founding director of the Pinnacle Lab for Analytics with China Ping An Insurance Group which focuses on social media and mobile data mining and analysis for finance industry with millions of dollars of support. The lab has nurtured a series of innovation and applications in the area of banking and insurance from underlying research breakthroughs in data mining and machine learning. Over the years, the outstanding work from the lab have helped Fortune-500 and other leading industrial giants in a number of industries with customized application platforms powered by big data engine. Prof. ZHU is also the founding director of DBS-SMU Life Analytics Lab, and the Founder and ChiefScientist of SYMPHONY, a Web3 blockchain-based protocol to empower a data-driven economy by democratized and collaborative data Intelligence with privacy by design. Prof. ZHU has over 100 peer-reviewed research publications at top international venues, including ICDE, VLDB, SIGMOD,KDD, WWW, JMLR, TODS, TKDE, etc.

name: Ms Neo Yi Lin
title: Enabling Precision in Public Health through Data Democratisation
abstract: The advancement of technology and the increasing uptake of wearable health devices has unlocked great potential for public health. However, organisations have typically relied on specialised teams of IT experts to process and analyse these data for high-level planning purposes. It is becoming increasingly important for data to be brought to the forefront in an accessible manner, beyond specialised teams, to all within the organisation. For example, business users can make use data to design and manage successful health programmes customised to individuals’ lifestyle patterns. The Health Promotion Board recently set up an independent team to specially look into how data can be better democratised for improved business operations. Learn about how we’re working to overcome challenges to bridge the analytics gap with support from our industry partners.
description: Ms Neo Yi Lin is a Deputy Director in the Chief Data Officer’s Office (CDOO) of Health Promotion Board. She heads the Data Engineering and Architecture department and is responsible for streamlining disparate health and lifestyle data into an integrated data repository. Beside ensuring the availability of trusted and quality data, Yi Lin also guides the team to productise common data needs to support data-driven decision making through HPB.  Prior to her current role, Yi Lin was with the Workplace Outreach Division and led the outreach strategy department to assist companies and workers to set up robust workplace health promotion programmes. Yi Lin was also a key member of the tobacco control unit and was primarily focused on driving tobacco control policies such as the ban on flavoured tobacco products, shisha and point-of-sales displays. She was also involved in developing smoking cessation programmes among lower income groups.

name: Mr Robert Brockman
org: Vice President, Digital Solutions Marketing & Product development, Meiyume Singapore
title: Beauty Intelligence Platform for Product & Sentiment Analysis
abstract: The MEIYUME and NUS Beauty Intelligence Platform revolutionizes the beauty industry with its real-time trend validation and detailed analysis of product sentiment, claims efficacy, consumer feedback, and competitor performance. This advanced AI tool provides vital insights at scale, helping Meiyume’s clients stay ahead in the fast-changing beauty market by aligning with consumer preferences and upcoming trends.
description: Robert Brockman is a seasoned Information Technology professional with over 15 years of experience driving digital innovation and transformation. His expertise lies in developing and executing strategic digital initiatives, leveraging emerging technologies, and fostering a digital-first culture to deliver sustainable business growth. Robert also drive research project within the data analytics centre in Meiyume and strategies for future R&D such as consumer behaviour and AI machine learning for further customer data insights. He is currently overseeing cross-functional teams and built lasting partnerships with stakeholders to align digital strategies with overall business objectives. Passionate about harnessing the power of data, Robert also has a strong track record of enhancing digital performance through data-driven decision-making.
